description.common: isocarboxazid increases effects of yohimbine by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Risk of acute hypertensive episode.

tranylcypromine increases effects of yohimbine by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Risk of acute hypertensive episode.

amitriptyline, yohimbine. Other (see comment). Avoid or Use Alternate Drug. 
Comment: Tricyclic antidepressants increase or decrease effects of sympathomimetics, by blocking reuptake of NE, or blocking uptake of indirect sympathomimetics into the adrenergic neuron.

yohimbine will decrease the level or effect of iobenguane I 131 by  Other (see comment). Avoid or Use Alternate Drug. Based on the mechanism of action of iobenguane, drugs that reduce catecholamine uptake or that deplete catecholamine stores may interfere with iobenguane uptake into cells, and thus, reduce iobenguane efficacy. Discontinue interfering drugs for at least 5 half-lives before administration of either the dosimetry or an iobenguane dose. Do not administer these drugs until at least 7 days after each iobenguane dose.

rasagiline increases effects of yohimbine by pharmacodynamic synergism. Avoid or Use Alternate Drug. Risk of acute hypertensive episode. It is recommended to avoid yohimbine during MAOI therapy and for 2 weeks after the discontinuation of a MAOI.

selegiline increases effects of yohimbine by pharmacodynamic synergism. Avoid or Use Alternate Drug. Risk of acute hypertensive episode. It is recommended to avoid yohimbine during MAOI therapy and for 2 weeks after the discontinuation of a MAOI.
